description: a(n) = least m such that if r and s in {h/(1 + h^2): h = 1,2,...,n} satisfy r < s, then r < k/m < s for some integer k.
comments: For a guide to related sequences, see A001000. - _Clark Kimberling_, Aug 07 2012
links: Clark Kimberling, Table of n, a(n) for n = 2..200
mathematica: leastSeparator[seq_] := Module[{n = 1},Table[While[Or @@ (Ceiling[n #1[[1]]] <2 + Floor[n #1[[2]]] &) /@ (Sort[#1, Greater] &) /@Partition[Take[seq, k], 2, 1], n++]; n, {k, 2, Length[seq]}]];t = Flatten[Table[h/(1 + h^2), {h, 1, 60}]]leastSeparator[t](* _Peter J. C. Moses_, Aug 01 2012 *)
author: _Clark Kimberling_
